thread.title: Scott Morrison seizes on Reserve Bank boss Philip Lowe's praise for Coalition business tax cut plan
thread.title_full: Scott Morrison seizes on Reserve Bank boss Philip Lowe's praise for Coalition business tax cut plan

author: Tom Mcilroy
title: Scott Morrison seizes on Reserve Bank boss Philip Lowe's praise for Coalition business tax cut plan
text:
Identity theft on the increase Identity theft on the increase 
Veda, a credit information bureau, found cases of identity theft rose 80 per cent from 2015 to 2016. More videos RBA governor backs company tax cuts 
Reserve Bank of Australia governor Philip Lowe says Australia needs to make sure its tax system is "internationally competitive". Vision courtesy ABC News 24 . 
He said Australia risked being left behind as international tax competition heated up, with governments working to attract foreign investment, conceding the moves could complicate work to restore the federal budget to balance. 
Repeatedly emphasising the Reserve Bank's independence, Mr Morrison called on the Senate to support the plan next month. Related Content RBA chief predicts Trump could boost economy 
"Dr Lowe's assessment, both of the economy and what's needed in the economy, I couldn't not agree more with," he said on Friday. 
"I think his clear articulation of the challenges that are in front of the Australian economy are a very sober and clear independent warning to the Parliament" that effective action is needed for the government to meet its 2021 timeline for a balanced budget. Advertisement 
Mr Morrison said Labor had run out of excuses in not supporting the tax cuts for big business, arguing that 15 years ago Australia had the ninth-lowest business tax rate among advanced economies but in 2017 only five of the 35 OECD nations had higher rates. 
The Senate appears likely to support moves to drop the 30 per cent corporate rate only for companies with turnover of up to $10 million. SHARE
